text: these past few weeks have seen a
stunning advance by the Syrian military
and its allies today the Army has taken
us here to char the area they recaptured
yesterday and you can see what heavy
fighting there's been here you can still
smell the explosives by recapturing this
area they were able to move towards the
ancient citadel and in doing so they
split the rebel forces and then quickly
seized the historic old city of Aleppo
it's a huge victory by President Assad's
forces but the battle isn't over yet
the remaining rebel fighters have
retreated to what's left of their rebel
endlave including the battle-hardened
fighters of the group known as the nusra
front linked to al Qaeda some of the
toughest battles in this war for Aleppo
are about to begin and so concern is
mounting for the tens of thousands of
civilians trapped there hundreds of
families have already fleeing into
government controlled West Aleppo the
others are trying to make it to rebel
areas which are not on the current front
lines there is a sense that the battle
for this strategic city is about to end
and that would be the biggest victory
for President Assad's forces since this
uprising began nearly six years ago
